title: Once a Global Covid-19 Vaccine Leader, Israel Struggles to Get Its Kids Inoculated
sub_head: About a quarter of Israeli children between 5 and 11 years old have got their first shot, despite an aggressive government campaign
body:
TEL AVIV—Israeli adults were among the first in the world to roll up their sleeves for a Covid-19 vaccine. But many of them are now pushing back against the government’s aggressive campaign to inoculate their young children, despite the Omicron risk.
Last year, Israel had one of the highest vaccination rates in the world, as the government drove an aggressive campaign to get Israelis the shots. But today, it has fallen behind other rich countries, in part due to Israelis’ reluctance to vaccinate children.
